text: just when they thought it was safe to go
into the water came an attack from an
unusual source a cooling morning swim by
families in this Argentinian River took
a bloody turn when a group of
carnivorous fish started biting the
bathers we attended a significant number
of casualties more or less 60 people of
those around seven or eight were
children
some were significant injuries or had
part of their finger missing another
with a missing toe and the rest of all
had bite marks these were the fish
responsible Paulo Metis relatives of the
piranhas that are native to South
American rivers one health officials
said there was some people that the fish
literally had torn bits of flesh from
the victims were swimming in the Parana
River near the city of Rosario but
feeding frenzies like this are extremely
rare while the river is a popular
bathing spot it was especially busy
because of the heat wave hitting the
region and despite the gruesome attack
many people rushed back into the water
to cool off only half an hour after the
fish struck Roland Hughes BBC news
